result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon S. Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
14CF52, Manufacture/Deliver THC 961.41(1)(h)1 was dismissed and read-in to this case. The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation in this case and 13CM259 are to run concurrent to each other as are  the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs  paid  from bond previously posted

Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent .
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence applies to count 1 of this case only. Defendant was granted huber priveleges and is to report on or before 8-9-14 at 7pm

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
